creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
The URL in the SOAP/XML Request Sampler is entered as one single string, and
stripped into its component parts for insertion into the superclass's
(HTTPSampler) by use of java.net.URL. Unfortunately, this class won't accept
${server} as a host name.

There's two solutions: either write the URL-splitting code ourselves or change
the HTTP Request Sampler to use a URL given as a single string too. This may be
a good idea, since it would get us rid of most of the HTTP Defaults Config
element (now replaced much favorably by the ${variables} concept) and in the
process correct bugs #12161 and #13948.

creator: jsalvata@atg.com
text:
After some discussion held long ago in the jmeter-dev list, it was concluded
that the best solution is to change the SOAP/XML GUI to enter
protocol/host/port/path separately (just as in the regular HTTP Request GUI).

Although this is a real pain, it doesn't usually prevent using the functionality
(I believe you CAN use ${vars} in the path part of the URL), so I'm marking this
as Priority Medium.
